title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 October 2014 - XWiki
content:
<lucaa> has joined #xwiki

09:33 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:02 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <tmortagne1> guys could you move from http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%226.3-milestone-1%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Unresolved%22%29 all the issues that won't be done for 6.3M1  
10:37 <tmortagne1> also is there anyone working on the 2 listed blockers ?  
10:38 <tmortagne1> pretty much the same question for issue assigned to 6.2.2 and 5.4.6 that we are supposed to release too  
10:40 <tmortagne1> has quit  
10:40 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <tmortagne> there is only XWIKI-11118 for 5.4.6  
10:43 <tmortagne> vmassol: should we block 5.4.6 until we get htmlcleaner 2.10 ?  
10:43 <vmassol> I don't think do  
10:43 <vmassol> 11118 doesn't look like a blocker  
10:43 <tmortagne> it's not tagged as such  
10:43 <vmassol> even though it's a regression, it seems to be an edge case not used that often  
10:44 <vmassol> checking the issue again now  
10:44 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: any idea what is blocking the 5.4.6 release ?  
10:44 <vmassol> yes it doesn't say why it's a blocekr  
10:44 <vmassol> how did you discover it?  
10:45 <tmortagne> discover ?  
10:45 <tmortagne> it's the only issue with fox for 5.4.6 as I said  
10:45 <vmassol> the verb: to discover  
10:45 <vmassol> to find out about something  
10:45 <vmassol> talking to gdelhumeau :)  
10:46 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: how did you discover the issue?  
10:46 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I didn't, Yacine reported it to me  
10:46 <gdelhumeau> he was trying to use the <legend> tag and ask me why it was not working  
10:47 <vmassol> ok  
10:47 <vmassol> so not a big deal IMO  
10:47 <vmassol> since there's a workaround  
10:47 <vmassol> clean=false  
10:47 <gdelhumeau> yes  
10:53 <tmortagne> ok removing the fix for then, it will be fixed when it will be fixed  
10:54 <vmassol> hmmm  
10:54 <vmassol> I'd still like to remember it  
10:54 <vmassol> so that at each release we check htmlcleaner  
10:54 <vmassol> and we push them if need be  
10:54 <vmassol> it's still a regression  
10:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: you are assigned to it  
10:56 <vmassol> that doesn'r help me :)  
10:57 <tmortagne> as far as I understand we are just waiting for htmlcleaner 2.10  
10:57 <vmassol> yes but we have power to make that come out faster  
10:57 <vmassol> actually  
10:57 <vmassol> we can even release it if we want  
10:57 <vmassol> in our plugin repo  
10:57 <tmortagne> put it in progress so that it's more visible to you  
10:57 <vmassol> I don't check that for releases  
10:57 <vmassol> all that matters for releases is fix versions  
10:58 <tmortagne> by plugin repo I guess you mean external repo and no we can't because htmlcleaner is a commons dependency  
10:59 <vmassol> indeed good point  
10:59 <vmassol> still let me set 6.3M2 as teh date  
10:59 <tmortagne> as you want  
11:06 <tmortagne> anyone looked at XWIKI-11152 ?  
11:40 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <vmassol> evalica: good morning  
12:00 <vmassol> did you see my comment about the forum issue about making all forum pages hidden?  
12:03 <evalica> I'm commenting on the issue  
12:03 <evalica> now  
12:03 <vmassol> ok thanks  
12:04 <evalica> done  
12:04 <evalica> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XAFORUM-22  
12:11 <gdelhumeau> are commits allowed today?  
12:12 <vmassol> if they stabilize the build yes :)  
12:12 <gdelhumeau> they fix bugs at least, but not discovered by CI  
12:12 <vmassol> we need to stabilize the build and all look at it  
12:12 <vmassol> if your commit doesn't endanger more the stability and it's a bug then it's ok I guess  
12:15 <vmassol> guys if you have an opinion on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XAFORUM-22 ....  
12:15 <vmassol> going for lunch and then we'll elect a RM for 6.3M1 :)  
12:15 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
12:25 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
12:25 <gdelhumeau> Guys, I don't know how to fix XWIKI-11206  
12:25 <gdelhumeau> But it seems sufficently important to consider that it should be fixed in 6.2.2  
12:26 <AFKGeek> has quit  
12:27 <gdelhumeau> XWIKI-11027 could be dangerous to fix just now, but maybe it should be done before users make big changes in their skins  
12:44 <Denis> has quit  
12:57 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> all functionnal tests are broken on 5.4.x because of "Browser setup is wrong somehow!"  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> Maybe we shoudl upgrade selenium on this branch too  
13:09 <Denis> has quit  
13:43 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <vmassol> guys, here are the stats per year about Releases per RM: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/31e7aed094eb6aa49a26  
13:48 <vmassol> what this shows is that Edy and Guillaume need to catch up a bit  
13:48 <vmassol> does that sounds fair?  
13:49 <vmassol> Enygma`, gdelhumeau?  
13:51 <Denis1> has quit  
13:51 <vmassol> should we count Caty? :)  
13:51 <vmassol> evalica: wdyt?  
13:52 <evalica> :)  
13:53 <evalica> I would have like to do releases … but I don't think I can manage one. I wouldn't know how to fix the tests… and I have still problems understand some things on the CI :)  
13:53 <vmassol> the RM is not suposed to fix any test  
13:53 <vmassol> he's supposed to make people fix the tests  
13:54 <vmassol> so that the release date can be achieved on time  
13:54 <evalica> that's not what I've seen :) in practice  
13:54 <vmassol> seriously I don't think there's anything preventing any committer from doing a release  
13:55 <vmassol> techniczally speaking  
13:55 <vmassol> \*technically  
13:55 <vmassol> haven't you done one release already BTW evalica?  
13:55 <tmortagne> evalica: not sure you really saw all, I can confirm you that it's not the RM who fix everything himself at each release  
13:56 <evalica> not everything… but at least he understands what/where the problem is and whom to contact  
13:56 <Enygma`> vmassol: I had my full share of releases recently, ty. I`ll pass the next ones if that`s an option.  
13:56 <vmassol> the only requirement for the RM is to be strong-willed to hassle the other to fix the tests :)  
13:57 <vmassol> Enygma`: well you're the one with the lowest score ATM… we need to find some metrcis to decide who is the next RM  
13:57 <vmassol> and I'm fed up  
13:57 <vmassol> to have to beg every time  
13:57 <vmassol> so let me know what you propose?  
13:57 <Enygma`> I was "lucky" enough to catch some really bad weather on our CI/test suites, so I`m not willing to hassle with it again  
13:57 <Enygma`> vmassol: those numbers don`t mean much when taken for all time  
13:58 <vmassol> they're tkane from the time in the project  
13:58 <vmassol> what's not fair?  
13:58 <vmassol> I even removed 1 year for you!  
13:58 <vmassol> to account for your absence  
13:58 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <Enygma`> yes, but after 4 releases in a row, in bad weather, you can`t compare my to someone who did not do a release in a long time  
13:58 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
13:59 <vmassol> actually you're worng  
13:59 <vmassol> you've had the easy part  
13:59 <Enygma`> seriously vmassol?  
13:59 <vmassol> you don't reemmber how hard it was to do releases early on  
13:59 <vmassol> yes eriously  
13:59 <vmassol> \*seriously  
13:59 <Enygma`> I had horrible problems with the state of the build, not with the build process itself  
13:59 <Enygma`> and nobody to help  
13:59 <vmassol> it's piece of cake now compared to before  
13:59 <Enygma`> so I had to do it all by myself  
14:00 <vmassol> on any way make a proposal  
14:00 <vmassol> as I said I'm fed up to have to beg  
14:00 <Enygma`> so please don`t disconsider that part  
14:00 <Enygma`> I`m +1 for an automatic schedule  
14:00 <Enygma`> I can respect that  
14:00 <vmassol> yeah sure and someone will say he had a cold when doing arelease  
14:00 <vmassol> so it's going to count double  
14:00 <vmassol> this is automatic schedule  
14:01 <vmassol> Enygma`: you seem to forget the 1 of days I spent to help you  
14:01 <vmassol> and to put back jenkins back in shape  
14:01 <Enygma`> so my this "schedule" I am supposed to do releases for the next 20 versions?  
14:02 <vmassol> so please don't say you were alone  
14:02 <Enygma`> \*by  
14:02 <vmassol> s/1 of day/1# of days  
14:02 <vmassol> I meant: "# of days"  
14:02 <Enygma`> was that during august?  
14:02 <Enygma`> because that is what I am mentioning now  
14:03 <Enygma`> but anyway, I know and thank you for the help  
14:03 <vmassol> september I think, not Augsut  
14:03 <vmassol> was on holidays in Augst :)  
14:03 <Enygma`> yes, you and the rest of the committers  
14:03 <vmassol> the thing is Enygma`, someone got to the releases  
14:03 <vmassol> it's not 100% automated yet...  
14:04 <vmassol> s/got to/got to do/  
14:04 <vmassol> I've asked 4 times  
14:04 <vmassol> no volunteers so far  
14:04 <vmassol> and we're past the deadline  
14:04 <Enygma`> don`t get me wrong, it`s not that I don`t like to do them  
14:04 <Enygma`> just that it always has a big impact on the amount of work I get to do for my own tasks  
14:04 <vmassol> so what do you suggest?  
14:05 <vmassol> so I see 2 laternatives:  
14:05 <vmassol> - GD  
14:05 <vmassol> - Caty  
14:05 <vmassol> (based on the stats)  
14:05 <vmassol> we could indeed mention one rule  
14:05 <vmassol> that the same person doesn't release twice in a row  
14:05 <vmassol> (to get rested)  
14:06 <Enygma`> we could include other non-XWiki-SAS committers?  
14:06 <vmassol> ahah  
14:06 <vmassol> go ahead!  
14:06 <vmassol> :)  
14:06 <Enygma`> yeah :)  
14:06 <Enygma`> I guess we have a problem with our model if we can`t achieve that  
14:06 <vmassol> not fully  
14:06 <Enygma`> what about Denis?  
14:07 <vmassol> it's kind of normal that peple paid to work full time on the open source project get to do more  
14:07 <Enygma`> of course  
14:09 <Denis> get me to the core team, and I will do all the releases you ever wanted ;)  
14:24 <gdelhumeau> back from lunch  
14:24 <gdelhumeau> I was volountter for 5.4.6  
14:24 <gdelhumeau> I accept to do 5.3M1 too  
14:30 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <gdelhumeau> what is the problem with jmeter?  
14:36 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: no idea but don't worry about that, looks like a preformance plugin bug, I reported it to them  
14:37 <gdelhumeau> it is not something that must be fixed for the release?  
14:37 <tmortagne> it's actually building find but then at the end it's sending a failing mail without any detailed reason  
14:37 <tmortagne> s/find/fine/  
14:38 <tmortagne> you even can see the complete stats for that build  
14:38 <tmortagne> but still it send a failure mail without any reason  
14:55 <gdelhumeau> Guys, do we consider XWIKI-11171 as a blocker  
14:55 <gdelhumeau> It is not the typical use case  
14:56 <gdelhumeau> It happens when you do edit -> FullScreen -> preview -> back  
15:04 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: any idea since when it's broken exactly ?  
15:17 <gdelhumeau> no  
15:17 <tmortagne> I would say the more recent it is the more blocker it is basically  
15:18 <tmortagne> if it's a regression caused by flamingo it's quite a blocker IMO for example  
15:18 <tmortagne> but if this use case is broken since before 4.0 and was reported only now not so much  
15:20 <gdelhumeau> I reproduce on colibri  
15:21 <gdelhumeau> so it should mean that it is old  
15:49 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <msmeria> has quit  
16:09 <vmassol> cool all jobs for 6.X are passing :)  
16:09 <vmassol> don't commit anything anymore!  
16:09 <vmassol> (for that branch)  
16:10 <vmassol> s/6.X/6.2.X  
16:10 <vmassol> actually  
16:10 <vmassol> I'm proposing to start the release now wdyt?  
16:10 <vmassol> checking the issue list  
16:11 <vmassol> hmm 2 blockers  
16:11 <vmassol> none assigned  
16:11 <vmassol> looking bad  
16:12 <gdelhumeau> and XWIKI-11206 might be considered as a blocker too  
16:12 <tmortagne> Enygma`: do you still plan to do XWIKI-6540 for 6.3M1 ?  
16:12 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: could you look at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11171 ?  
16:12 <vmassol> mflorea: could you check this one quickly to see if you can fix it or let us know how? http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11152  
16:13 <vmassol> (or reply to guillaume's question in comment)  
16:14 <mflorea> vmassol: I will look into  
16:15 <vmassol> ok thanks  
16:16 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: if you cannot fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11206 what are you proposing to do?  
16:16 <gdelhumeau> I don't know  
16:16 <Enygma`> tmortagne: push it to 6.3M2  
16:16 <gdelhumeau> except not supporting IE9, which does not seen acceptable  
16:16 <gdelhumeau> \*seem  
16:18 <vmassol> then I still propose that we release 6.2.2 without it and that you continue trying to find a fix for 6.2.3, wdyt?  
16:18 <vmassol> it's better to have all the other fixes released than nothing....  
16:19 <gdelhumeau> it make sense to have a stable release for people that does not need the ie9 support  
16:19 <vmassol> and we put that information in the Release notes  
16:19 <vmassol> for 6.2.2  
16:19 <gdelhumeau> k  
16:19 <vmassol> ok so moving to 6.2.3 for now  
16:19 <gdelhumeau> regarding XWIKI-11027, I propose to not fix it in 6.2.x, since it is possibly a breaking change  
16:20 <vmassol> ok  
16:20 <gdelhumeau> an the other hand, it would make harder to upgrade a custom skin created from flamingo in the 6.2.x version  
16:20 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: moving it to 6.2.3 thenok ?  
16:20 <vmassol> \*then ok  
16:21 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:22 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: wdyt: should we move it to 6.3.x or 6.2.3? breaking change vs. harder to upgrade to 6.3  
16:23 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I don't know. If the change is not dangerous, 6.2.3 seems better. WDYM by breaking hcange?  
16:23 <mflorea> tmortagne: yes, looks like I removed it on purpose because it wasn't needed anymore  
16:24 <tmortagne> mflorea: ok, removing it then  
16:24 <gdelhumeau> VMs will be moved from a directory to an other, so if someone has changed the VM, it will be much harder to upgrade  
16:24 <gdelhumeau> actually it is the same problem  
16:24 <gdelhumeau> but we just decide in which version we want to have it  
16:24 <vmassol> from what you say the sooner the better  
16:24 <gdelhumeau> between 6.2.2 -> 6.2.3 : in a dot release?  
16:24 <gdelhumeau> between 6.2.2 -> 6.3: in a major release?  
16:25 <gdelhumeau> since we can consider that 6.2.x are not really dot releases, it make sense to fix it the sooner  
16:25 <tmortagne> mflorea: looks like there is one missing in DashboardMacro compared to Treeview.xml  
16:25 <vmassol> it's a pity that flamingo was considered usable before this was done, let's learn for the future  
16:25 <tmortagne> not sure if it's important  
16:25 <tmortagne> it's "js/smartclient/skins/Enterprise/load\_skin.js'"  
16:26 <tmortagne> this one is loaded in  Treeview.xml but not in DashboardMacro  
16:26 <tmortagne> do you think we should add it to DashboardMacro ?  
16:27 <tmortagne> (also looks like that list id duplicated in way too many places, should probably be put behind some API)  
16:27 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
16:28 <mflorea> I don't think we need. The reason the Dashboard macro is including the smartclient resources is because the dashboard uses the Macro dialog from the WYSIWYG editor, and the editor has a dep on smartclient which unfortunately must be present on load. But smartclient is used only for the tree and we don't need the tree on the dashboard macro  
16:28 <tmortagne> ok  
16:29 <tmortagne> keeping it like this then  
16:29 <tmortagne> I guess moving to your new tree will cleanup all that, right ?  
16:29 <mflorea> yep  
16:29 <mflorea> no reason to handle the duplicated lines fro now  
16:32 <tmortagne> ok so the only blocker left for 6.3 is XWIKI-11171  
16:32 <tmortagne> anyone has any idea ?  
16:32 <tmortagne> will test it in older versions  
16:33 <vmassol> same for 6.2.2  
16:33 <vmassol> ;)  
16:34 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you didn't reploy to my question earlier about "gdelhumeau: could you look at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11171 ?"?  
16:34 <gdelhumeau> I am looking at it  
16:34 <gdelhumeau> debugging the javascript  
16:34 <vmassol> ok assigning you, thanks  
16:34 <tmortagne> note: no issue on 5.4.5 so it seems quite recent  
16:36 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: are you debugging on SNAPSHOT or 6.2.1 ?  
16:36 <gdelhumeau> SNAPSHOT  
16:36 <tmortagne> ok  
16:40 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: note that I cannot reproduce the issue with FF 32.0.3 on Ubuntu (I guess you have pretty much the same setup)  
16:40 <tmortagne> ha wait  
16:40 <tmortagne> I think I missed one step  
16:41 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: ok forget everything I said, I can reproduce it on 5.4.5, will test older versions  
16:41 <gdelhumeau> exit fullscreen at the end  
16:47 <AFKGeek> has quit  
16:49 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it's older than 4.5.4  
16:50 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you forgot to merge some RN from 6.2.2 to 6.3M1, doing it  
16:54 <momomomomo> has quit  
17:05 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:12 <vmassol> guys you don't have this in your logs on master: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/fe1d4fa83e1d7bc2212f/raw/26972770cd1700524fb40dc52028c87685435ac8/gistfile1.txt ?  
17:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: might be caused by some of your recetn changes  
17:17 <tmortagne> vmassol: you are probably not very up to date, as I told you friday or yesterday it was XWIKI-11204  
17:18 <vmassol> hmm strange I rebuilt enterprise yesterday I think  
17:18 <vmassol> doing it again  
17:28 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
17:31 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
17:36 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: is there an api to get the list of wikis the logged-in user can view?  
17:36 <gdelhumeau> no API  
17:36 <vmassol> :(  
17:37 <vmassol> checking how you did it in the wiki index now
